name: Charizard
Ability1Text: Each of Charizard's attacks does 10 more damage for each Fire Pokemon on your Bench to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charizard.

name: Froslass
flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Froslass from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium Card in play, this attack does nothing.

name: Heatran
flavorText: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire or Metal Energy card you discarded.

name: Kabutops
flavorText: It is thought that this Pokemon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.
Attack1Text: You may discard Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber from your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Luxray
flavorText: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: If Luxray has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, you may do 100 damage instead of 60 to the Defending Pokemon. If you do, discard that Pokemon Tool card.

name: Mothim
flavorText: While it loves floral honey, it won't gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Burmy and Wormadam, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Probopass
Ability1Text: If you don't have a Supporter card in play, each of Probopass's attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Salamence
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. If that card isn't a basic Energy card, discard it. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Swalot
flavorText: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
Attack1Text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokemon until the Defending Pokemon has the same remaining HP as Swalot. (If the Defending Pokemon has the same or less remaining HP as Swalot, this attack does nothing.)
Attack2Text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokemon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Tangrowth by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokemon and Tangrowth. If the Defending Pokemon has fewer remaining HP than Tangrowth's, this attack does 120 damage instead.

name: Toxicroak
flavorText: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for more potency.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If Toxicroak has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. If Toxicroak has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Zapdos G
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Zapdos G.
Attack2Text: You may discard all Lightning attached to Zapdos G. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

name: Aerodactyl
flavorText: A Pokemon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber, show it your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: The Retreat Cost for Bronzong is 0 until the end of your next turn.

name: Cherrim
flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Ability1Text: If any of your Grass Pokemon or Fire Pokemon would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Gengar
flavorText: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon. This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) You may switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Gengar
flavorText: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Glalie
flavorText: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Golem
Attack2Text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. The attack does 30 damage times the number of Fighting Energy cards you discarded.

name: Hariyama
flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokemon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

name: Lopunny
flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy card from your hand. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon. This power can't be used if Lopunny is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions from Lopunny.

name: Manectric
flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Omastar
flavorText: It is thought that this Pokemon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokemon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokemon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, and Old Amber in your discard pile.

name: Pelipper
flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokemon and eggs to safety in its bill.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Pichu
flavorText: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Porygon-Z G
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Porygon-Z G from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokemon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
Attack1Text: If Raichu has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Discard a Lightning Energy card attached to Raichu.

name: Rapidash
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash by your opponent's Pokemon SP.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Raticate
flavorText: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Supporter card you find there, and discard it. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.
Attack2Text: If Raticate has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Sceptile
Ability1Text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Sceptile, remove 2 damage counters from Sceptile.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to Sceptile.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Sceptile
flavorText: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.
Attack1Text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

name: Spiritomb
Ability1Text: As long as Spiritomb is your Active Pokemon, each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokemon and put it onto that Pokemon. (This counts as evolving that Pokemon.) If you do, put 1 damage counter on Spiritomb. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: There are researchers who believe this Pokemon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
Attack2Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gastly
flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Graveler
flavorText: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokemon can stop it without difficulty.
Attack2Text: Graveler does 10 damage to itself.

name: Grovyle
flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

name: Grovyle
flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Gulpin
flavorText: Almost all of its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Gulpin would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Gulpin is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

name: Haunter
flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Ability1Text: If Haunter is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Haunter is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Haunter
flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
Attack2Text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxio. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Manectric
flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

name: Pelipper
flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokemon and eggs to safety in its bill.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Pelipper.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Ponyta and put it onto Ponyta. (This counts as evolving Ponyta.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Rapidash
flavorText: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Shelgon
flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If Shelgon has any basic Fire Energy and any basic Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Wormadam Plant Cloak
flavorText: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If you have Wormadam Sandy Cloak in play, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

name: Wormadam Sandy Cloak
flavorText: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Attack2Text: If you have Wormadam Trash Cloak in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Wormadam Trash Cloak
flavorText: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. If you have Wormadam Plant Cloak in play, this attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of his or her deck.

name: Bagon
flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Beedrill G
Attack1Text: If you played Beedrill G from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: There are researchers who believe this Pokemon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Buneary
flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Burmy Plant Cloak
flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
Ability1Text: Burmy Plant Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

name: Burmy Sandy Cloak
flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
Ability1Text: Burmy Sandy Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

name: Burmy Trash Cloak
flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
Ability1Text: Burmy Trash Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

name: Charmander
flavorText: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Fire Basic Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

name: Croagunk
flavorText: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Electrike
flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrike does 10 damage to itself.

name: Electrike
flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

name: Gastly
flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

name: Geodude
flavorText: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gulpin
flavorText: Almost all of its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Kabuto
flavorText: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Makuhita
flavorText: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Nosepass would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Nosepass if that damage is 30 or less.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Omanyte
flavorText: A Pokemon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Attack2Text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Pikachu and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Ponyta
flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Tangela
flavorText: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Tangela.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Tangela
flavorText: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Treecko
flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Treecko
flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

name: Wingull
flavorText: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, Wingull can't use Slashing Strike.

name: Wingull
flavorText: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

name: Old Amber
Ability1Text: As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Dome Fossil
Ability1Text: When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Helix Fossil
Ability1Text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Arceus LV.X
Ability1Text: Arceus LV. X's type is the same type as its previous Level.
Ability2Text: Arceus can use the attacks of all Arceus you have in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

name: Arceus LV.X
Ability1Text: Arceus LV.X's type is the same as its previous Level.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 100.

name: Arceus LV.X
Ability1Text: Arceus LV.X's type is the same type as its previous Level.
Attack1Text: Discard a Lightning Energy and a Psychic Energy attached to Arceus.

name: Gengar LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon LV.X. Remove the Level-Up card from that Pokemon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck. The power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon that already has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Salamence LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Salamence LV.X from your hand onto your Active Salamence, you may use this power. For each of your opponent's Pokemon that is Knocked Out by damage from Salamence's attacks this turn, take 1 more Prize card.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy card attached to Salamence.

name: Tangrowth LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokemon. This power can't be used if Tangrowth is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for as many Grass Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Bagon
flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
Ability1Text: As long as Bagon has any Energy attached to it, Bagon has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Ability1Text: As long as Ponyta has any Energy attached to it, Ponyta has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Ponyta.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Ability1Text: As long as Shinx has any Energy attached to it, Shinx has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokemon was born before the universe even existed.
Attack1Text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is described in mythology as the Pokemon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy attached to Arceus.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokemon was born before the universe even existed.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
Attack1Text: If you have 6 Arceus in play and each of them is a different type, search your deck for up to 6 basic Energy cards. Attach each of those Energy cards to a different Pokemon you have in play. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Remove all Energy cards attached to Arceus and put them in the Lost Zone.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is described in mythology as the Pokemon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
Attack1Text: Switch Arceus with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokemon was born before the universe even existed.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Arceus
flavorText: It is described in mythology as the Pokemon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
Attack1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Arceus by Pokemon LV.X during your opponent's next turn.
